author: B Kolappan
text:
In what could come as great relief to protesting differently abled persons, Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Saturday announced that people with 40 % disability were eligible for government’s financial aid of Rs. 1000 a month.

Making a suo motu statement in the Assembly, she said the clause, “destitute,” would be dispensed with and any unemployed person who had 40 per cent disability would get the monthly financial assistance. A person not having assets worth over Rs. 50,000, son and grandson or wife was defined as destitute.

Ms. Jayalalithaa said her government had ensured three per cent employment for differently abled persons in government and public sector undertakings and so far 5,633 persons had been appointed in government jobs.

“To monitor the welfare schemes and advise the government on issues concerning the differently abled, the government will form a committee headed by the Social Welfare Minister,” she said.

Expressing happiness over co-operation extended by MLAs elected to the 14{+t}{+h}Assembly, Ms. Jayalalithaa said even though the House had witnessed heated arguments, the Opposition members acted without any vengeance. She also thanked Speaker P. Dhanapal and leader of the House O. Panneerselvam.
title: People with 40 per cent disability eligible for aid
